title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: When a WSWB session is open with a dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows without saving causes the loss of changes in the .txt file.
EB: When shutting down Windows with a dirty .txt file open in WSWB, a warning or question message box should be displayed, giving users a chance to save their changes before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
SR:
1. Open WSWB.
2. Create a new project.
3. Create a text file in the project.
4. Add a line of text to the text file.
5. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
6. Left click on the Windows Start menu.
7. Select the "Shut Down" command to shut down/reboot the computer.

Expected Result: A warning or question message box should be displayed, allowing the user to save their changes before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
